benefits.title: Red Yeast Rice for Dyslipidemia in Statin-Intolerant Patients
benefits.summary: Red yeast rice significantly improves LDL and total cholesterol levels in patients with statin-associated myalgias.

benefits.title: [OP.8E.07] MIDDLE-TERM DIETARY SUPPLEMENTATION WITH RED YEAST RICE PLUS COENZYME Q10 IMPROVES LIPID PATTERN, ENDOTHELIAL REACTIVITY AND ARTERIAL STIFFNESS IN MODERATELY HYPERCHOLESTEROLEMICS
benefits.summary: Red yeast rice supplementation with 10 mg monacolins improves LDL-cholesterolemia, endothelial reactivity, and pulse wave velocity in moderately hypercholesterolemic subjects.

benefits.title: Health Benefits and Clinical Impact of Major Nutrient, Red Yeast Rice: A Review
benefits.summary: Red Yeast Rice (RYR) is effective for managing cholesterol, diabetes, cardiovascular disease, and preventing cancer.

benefits.title: Life-span extension by pigmented rice bran in the model yeast Saccharomyces cerevisiae
benefits.summary: Red rice bran extract and bioactive compounds, quercetin and protocatechuic acid, can reduce intracellular reactive oxygen species (ROS) and prolong the life-span of yeast cells.

benefits.title: Impact of Red Yeast Rice on Metabolic Diseases: A Review of Possible Mechanisms of Action.
benefits.summary: Red yeast rice may be beneficial in the prevention and treatment of metabolic diseases, such as atherosclerosis, dyslipidemia, diabetes, hypertension, and obesity.
benefits.journal: Journal of agricultural and food chemistry

benefits.title: A Review of Red Yeast Rice, a Traditional Fermented Food in Japan and East Asia: Its Characteristic Ingredients and Application in the Maintenance and Improvement of Health in Lipid Metabolism and the Circulatory System
benefits.summary: Red yeast rice has beneficial effects in improving lipid metabolism and the circulatory system, and its safety as a functional food.

benefits.title: Quantitative Determination of Lovastatin from Dietary Supplements Containing Red Yeast Rice Extracts by using HPLC-UV-MS and UPLC-UV-MS Methods
benefits.summary: Red yeast rice may provide benefits beyond those provided by statins, such as decreasing cholesterol levels and stimulating bone formation.

benefits.title: Low-dose statin concentration in red yeast rice: a confounding effect on outcome?
benefits.summary: Red yeast rice combined with lifestyle changes and fish oil can improve lipid profile in obese patients, with similar results as therapeutic doses of statins.

benefits.title: Prevention: Lowering cholesterol in statin-intolerant patients
benefits.summary: Red yeast rice supplementation significantly drops LDL cholesterol and total cholesterol in statin-intolerant patients.

benefits.title: MULTICENTER CLINICAL TRIAL OF THE SERUM LIPID-LOWERING EFFECTS OF A MONASCUS PURPUREUS (RED YEAST) RICE PREPARATION FROM TRADITIONAL CHINESE MEDICINE
benefits.summary: Red Yeast Rice is extremely effective and well tolerated in reducing elevated serum cholesterol and triglycerides.

side effects.title: MULTICENTER CLINICAL TRIAL OF THE SERUM LIPID-LOWERING EFFECTS OF A MONASCUS PURPUREUS (RED YEAST) RICE PREPARATION FROM TRADITIONAL CHINESE MEDICINE
side effects.summary: Red Yeast Rice is effective and well tolerated in reducing elevated serum cholesterol and triglycerides, with mild side effects like heartburn, flatulence, and dizziness.

side effects.title: [Red yeast rice: An unsafe food supplement?]
side effects.summary: Red yeast rice can contain the mycotoxin citrinin and other substances not yet toxicologically evaluated, potentially causing severe side effects like muscle damage and kidney failure.

side effects.title: Rhabdomyolysis Related to Red Yeast Rice Ingestion
side effects.summary: Red yeast rice may cause rhabdomyolysis, a condition involving muscle weakness and chest discomfort.

side effects.title: Red yeast rice induces less muscle fatigue symptom than simvastatin in dyslipidemic patients: a single center randomized pilot trial
side effects.summary: Red yeast rice induced less muscle fatigue side effect and exerted comparable lipid-lowering effects compared to simvastatin in dyslipidemic patients with low to moderate cardiovascular risk.

side effects.title: PERBANDINGAN BERAS RAGI MERAH DAN SIMVASTATIN DALAM MENURUNKAN PROFIL LIPID : EVIDENCE-BASED CASE REPORT
side effects.summary: Red yeast rice (RYR) shows less fatigue side effect than simvastatin, making it an alternative for patients experiencing statin-associated myalgia.
side effects.journal: IJCNP (INDONESIAN JOURNAL OF CLINICAL NUTRITION PHYSICIAN)

side effects.title: New Monascus metabolites: structure elucidation and toxicological properties studied with immortalized human kidney epithelial cells.
side effects.summary: Monascopyridines C and D, found in red yeast rice, have cytotoxic effects and might contribute to tumor formations.

side effects.title: More on the Chinese red-yeast-rice supplement and its cholesterol-lowering effect.
side effects.summary: Red yeast rice supplementation modestly reduced total cholesterol, LDL-cholesterol, and total triacylglycerol concentrations in patients with hyperlipidemia.
side effects.journal: The American journal of clinical nutrition

side effects.title: AB0453 RED RICE YEAST. AN ALTERNATIVE IN RHEUMATOID ARTHRITIS AND HYPERLIPIDEMIA
side effects.summary: Red rice yeast significantly decreased total cholesterol (TC) and LDL levels in patients with rheumatoid arthritis.

side effects.title: Red Yeast Rice to Treat Cholesterol Problems in Patients Who Cannot Tolerate Statin Therapy Because of Muscle Pain
side effects.summary: Red yeast rice capsules may lower LDL and total cholesterol levels without causing muscle pain in patients who cannot take statins due to muscle pain.

side effects.title: A Meta-Analysis of Red Yeast Rice: An Effective and Relatively Safe Alternative Approach for Dyslipidemia
side effects.summary: Red yeast rice is an effective and relatively safe approach for dyslipidemia, with no serious side effects reported in all trials.

dosage.title: Cholesterol-lowering effects of a proprietary Chinese red-yeast-rice dietary supplement.
dosage.summary: Red yeast rice (2.4 g/d) significantly reduces total cholesterol, LDL cholesterol, and total triacylglycerol concentrations compared to placebo.
dosage.journal: The American journal of clinical nutrition

dosage.title: Tolerability of red yeast rice (2,400 mg twice daily) versus pravastatin (20 mg twice daily) in patients with previous statin intolerance.
dosage.summary: Red yeast rice dosage is 2,400 mg twice daily.

dosage.title: Efficacy of Monascus purpureus Went rice on lowering lipid ratios in hypercholesterolemic patients
dosage.summary: A twice-daily dose of 600 mg red yeast rice for 8 weeks significantly reduced lipid ratios in hypercholesterolemic patients.

dosage.title: NMR evaluation of total statin content and HMG-CoA reductase inhibition in red yeast rice (Monascus spp.) food supplements
dosage.summary: The total statin concentrations of five red yeast rice supplements were between 1.5 and 25.2 mg per specified daily dose.

dosage.title: Risk Assessment of RYR Food Supplements: Perception vs. Reality
dosage.summary: Only 19 red yeast rice food supplements offered a daily dosage exceeding 10 mg as dictated by the health claim granted by EFSA in the EU.

dosage.title: Resveratrol improves the lipid profile promoted by red yeast rice (monacolin k) in patients with moderate dyslipidemia: An open-label, randomized, parallel-group controlled clinical trial
dosage.summary: Red yeast rice extract (10 mg monacolin K) led to a 20% reduction in total cholesterol and 21% reduction in low-density lipoprotein-cholesterol.

dosage.title: Effect of Red Yeast Rice on Cognitive Functioning in Schizophrenia: Data From a Pilot Study
dosage.summary: Red yeast rice supplementation at a daily dosage of 200 mg/d significantly improved cognitive deficits in schizophrenia.

dosage.title: The Color of Rice and the Chinese Paradox
dosage.summary: Red rice yeast supplements with 5-10 mg lovastatin per capsule have demonstrated efficacy in lowering total and LDL cholesterol.

dosage.title: Red Yeast Rice for Hypercholesterolemia.
dosage.summary: Consuming up to 10 mg of monacolin K daily from red yeast rice extract reduces LDL cholesterol plasma levels between 15% and 25% within 6 to 8 weeks.

dosage.title: [Red yeast rice, monacolin K, and pleiotropic effects.]
dosage.summary: Red yeast rice extract with monacolin K concentration of 10 mg per daily dose can reduce LDL-cholesterol plasma levels by 15-25% in 6-8 weeks.
